titleStmt.title: Letter from William F. Cody to Ezekiel Jarman Ayers, January 27, 1916
titleStmt.author: Cody, William Frederick, 1846-1917

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

notesStmt.note: Reproduction from NARA files (photocopy) held in McCracken Research Library.

bibl.author: Cody, William Frederick, 1846-1917
bibl.title: Letter from William F. Cody to Ezekiel Jarman Ayers

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration: Record Group 48, Department of the Interior, Office of the Secretary, Central Classified File 1907-1936, 5-2 Indians, Moving Pictures

opener.stamp:
CHIEF CLERK
JAN 28 1916
DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR

div1.p: In reply to your favor of Jan 14th 1916 — Will say The reason the of the long delay for the delivery of the Indian War Pictures was that I was in the west. But in December last I took the Reels my self to Washington. I called at Secretary Lanes2 office. But failing to find him I called on Secretary Garrison3. And left the Reels or Films with his Secretary who promised to notify Secretary Lane that he had a set of the Reels or films for his department. If you will kindly communicate with with the Secretary to Secretary Garrison, I think you will find everything allright.

closer.signed:
W. F. Cody
The address above will reach me.

back.note: Note 1: Ezekiel Jarman Ayers (1866-1931) was Chief Clerk, Department of Interior, Superintendent of Buildings, and Acting Assistant Secretary of Interior; he was appointed by Secretary of War Franklin K. Lane in 1911, serving until his resignation in 1920.
Note 2: Franklin Knight Lane (1864-1921) served as United States Secretary of the Interior from 1913 to 1920.
Note 3: Lindley Miller Garrison (1864-1932), New Jersey lawyer, served as Secretary of War under President Woodrow Wilson between 1913 and 1916.
